name: 4L Trophy
description: Rally using a 4L to deliver school and sports supplies to children in the desert. 900 teams of 2 at the start. 6000 km traveled between France, Spain, and Morocco. Adventure, mechanics, discovery!

name: Internship at Citegestion (EDF)
intro: Development of a web application for data visualization
description: The backend of the application retrieves data from the database on the number of interventions per equipment. The frontend displays the data in two different ways: the trend of a data or the correlation between two data sets. Users drag the data into boxes to initiate analysis. They can also choose the sampling frequency and date range. Options for single or multi-trend analysis over the chosen period.

name: Jukebox
intro: Creation of a jukebox, divided into two parts: a web application to view available CDs and choose one, and a 'machine' part (see model on the right), with a motor system and an electromagnet that positions the selected CD on the player.
description:
A project that encompasses various domains: web development, electronics, mechanics, modeling, and project management. The web application is ready, and a significant portion of the component management code has been validated. I still need to build the object to begin testing movement. Also, I need to validate the 'grabbing' of the CD, placement on the wall, and player.
Project on hold due to an overseas internship that doesn't allow bringing the equipment. Resuming in November 2023.
Demo of the application is available, but not optimized for smartphones as the application will be displayed on a larger screen.

name: Radio-Controlled Plane
intro: For this project, I started by buying an EPP glider and equipped it with a motor, 2 servo motors, 1 receiver, and a battery for control.
description:
First attempt: 3 flights lasting 1 to 2 seconds. The plane wasn't balanced enough to be stable and was too heavy, which I realized later.
Second attempt: 3 flights. Great balance but the plane still too heavy. So, I decided to add a second wing on top.
Third attempt, the plane 'flies' for a few seconds. The second wing made the plane less stable, and control was quite tricky, but it stayed in the air longer. After a major crash, one wing broke... So, I decided to move on to a more serious model.

name: Radio-Controlled Plane V2
intro: New version of a radio-controlled plane, larger and made of cardboard.
description:
For this project, I obtained plans for a radio-controlled plane from the internet. I began by gluing the plans onto cardboard to cut out each piece. After cutting the pieces, I followed the assembly steps to glue them together and also reused some components from my previous plane.
Before flying it, I balanced the plane and configured its components.
Initial flights: the engine wasn't powerful enough for the plane's size, and the balance could be improved. However, the plane was more robust and easier to control than the first model.
For the next steps, I installed a more powerful engine, but it didn't significantly improve flight performance. It eventually broke due to multiple crashes.
For the next model, I'm planning to build a glider to focus on construction and flying without the motor constraint.

name: 3D Web Game
description: I attempted to recreate the zombie mode from BO2 (Call of Duty) in a browser. I used VueJs to create a web app and discovered and used the ThreeJs and AmmoJs frameworks for 3D and adding physics to the 3D environment. Here's the app. The game is still in development, so there are many things to adjust.

name: Internship in Ireland: Horse Motion Capture
intro: The goal of this internship is to capture horse movements for 3D display
description: For this project, there were two of us working together. We used ESP32s and accelerometer and gyroscope sensors to capture movements. Multiple ESPs were placed on the horse's joints to capture a wide range of movements. They were all connected via WiFi to another ESP32 serving as a base. The base sent all data as it arrived to an application for visualization and data storage.
